newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EARLY SLOVAK NATO MEMBERSHIP STILL POSSIBLE - KOVAC.
newsitem.headline: EARLY SLOVAK NATO MEMBERSHIP STILL POSSIBLE - KOVAC.

text.p: Slovak President Michal Kovac said on Thursday he believed his small country still had a chance of joining NATO with its neighbours when the alliance takes in its first new members by the turn of the century.
"I was convinced the chances of the Slovak Republic to be with its neighbours in the first group is still present," he told reporters after meeting NATO's 16 ambassadors.
Kovac, who has been involved in a bitter feud with Prime Minister Vladimir Meciar, said it was now "in the hands of the government" to ensure Slovakia met all the conditions.
The U.S. House of Representatives in July authorised up to $60 million to help three leading NATO applicants -- Poland, the Czech Republic and Hungary -- to prepare for membership.
It did not include Slovakia which many western diplomats rule out on the grounds of human rights' abuses and lack of real democratic controls of the government.
Kovac said he thought the West's view of the situation in his country was broadly correct and objective.
"The West is criticising the same things, I myself have been criticising," he said. REUTER 171838 GMT oct 96
